body: Thanks for the feedback, and I tentatively assigned your request to 5.5 M2 for _team discussion_.

**Team Decision:** Let's add overloads that take a `String` or `Supplier<String>`.

@tcfurrer Would you be interested in submitting a PR for this?
@sormuras Or would you like to do this one?
Yes, I do. Unless @tcfurrer has already a PR at hand.
I think it should behave like all other assertions and prepend the message (1), possibly calling `AssertionUtils.buildPrefix`.

> I think it should behave like all other assertions and prepend the message (1), possibly calling `AssertionUtils.buildPrefix`.

Yes, please be consistent with the rest of the assertion messages.

So, +1 for both of Marc's comments.

Alright. Will file a PR later today.

Will also improve the layout of the "difference message". From

```text
[custom message ==> ]more actual lines than expected: 1 ==> expected: <first line
second line
third line> but was: <first line
second line
third line
last line>
```

to

```text
[custom message ==> ]more actual lines than expected: 1 ==> expected: <
first line
second line
third line
> but was: <
first line
second line
third line
last line
>
```

issue.title: Add assertLinesMatch overloads taking a custom message

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Prior to this commit, `Assertions.assertLinesMatch` was the only assertion that didn't support user-supplied error messages. This commit adds overloads that take a String or Supplier<String> as a custom message. That message is prepended to the automatically generated detail message.

This commit also improves the textual layout of the automatically generated detail message by emitting each expected and actual line into a dedicated new line.

Closes #1855

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

- [x] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [x] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](http://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [x] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
